email_content:
Hello MedTech Solutions Team,

I hope you’re doing well. I’m reaching out on behalf of Greenleaf Health Center regarding the upcoming software update for our scheduling and management system that is slated for mid-April.

To ensure a smooth transition, we wanted to share a few operational considerations and requests:

1. Planned Downtime Window
   • Please confirm the anticipated start and end of any system downtime so we can prepare contingency plans.
   • A minimum 48-hour advance notice of the finalized window would be extremely helpful.

2. Appointment Volume During That Week
   • Mid-April is one of our busiest periods, with several dozen patient visits and procedures scheduled each day.
   • Even a short outage will require us to coordinate alternative booking and check-in methods, so accuracy of the downtime schedule is critical.

3. Access to Key Functions Offline
   • During the downtime we will still need reference access to patients’ basic appointment details and contact information.
   • If an export or read-only mode is available, please advise on how to set this up in advance.

4. Staff Preparation & Training Materials
   • We plan to hold brief refresher sessions for our front-office team prior to the update. Any quick-start guides, release notes, or feature summaries you can share ahead of time will make this training more effective.

5. Call to Review Deployment Plan
   • Could we schedule a short call early next week to walk through the update steps and contingency measures? Please let us know your availability.

Thank you for your assistance. We appreciate your partnership in keeping our practice running smoothly and our patient experience uninterrupted.

Best regards,

Jane Doe
Medical Administrative Assistant
Greenleaf Health Center
